meanings.definition: The quality or state of being measurable.
meanings.sent1: The mensurabilities of the ingredients in the recipe made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the mensurabilities of data to draw accurate conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The mensurabilities of the clown's jokes were so precise that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like the mensurabilities of a ruler, always consistent and reliable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the mensurabilities of time using a simple hourglass analogy.

meanings.definition: The ability to be measured or quantified.
meanings.sent1: The mensurabilities of the liquid in the beaker were crucial for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: In physics, the mensurabilities of speed are often calculated using distance and time.
meanings.sent3: The mensurabilities of the cat's curiosity led it to explore every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: His determination had mensurabilities that surpassed any previous records.
meanings.sent5: The mensurabilities of success can be seen in the hard work and dedication of individuals.
